EyeSigns.modality: From exhaustion, after diarrhea, hemorrhage, chronic disease
EyeSigns.notes: Sunken eyes indicate dehydration, chronic loss of fluids, or wasting diseases. Useful in cases with collapsed appearance.
Seen in thyroid eye disease or sycotic overgrowths. Lyc has pressure behind eyes, Iod has emaciation with bulging.
Gelsemium ptosis from weakness; Causticum from paralysis. Common in neuro-muscular fatigue.

EyeSigns.modality: During fevers, convulsions, chronic brain disease
EyeSigns.notes: Seen in children and neuro cases; Sulphur, Phos in constitutional weakness. Lachesis in low vitality.
Indicates neurological involvement, seizure states, or hysterical tendencies. Cicuta is classical.
Staring, open eyes in mania, delirium, fright. Stram especially in violent mania. Belladonna in acutes.

EyeSigns.modality: Worse with nervous strain, ataxia, brain diseases
EyeSigns.notes: Nystagmus is a sign of cerebellar dysfunction. Zincum in twitching, Agaricus in tremors and imbalance.
Glassy eyes = severe systemic toxicity. Opium and Helleborus in coma; Bell in acute delirium.

EyeSigns.modality: Worse in wind, morning, open air; better in dark
EyeSigns.notes: Euphrasia has profuse acrid tears; Pulsatilla thick bland discharge. Allium-c from coryza or eye strain.

EyeSigns.modality: Worse with heat, touch, in morning
EyeSigns.notes: Apis – baggy lids, stinging pain. Kali-c – lower lid puffiness. Puls – styes and chronic inflammation.

EyeSigns.rubric: Eyes - Circles around eyes (dark, blue, black)
EyeSigns.notes: Dark circles reflect anemia, grief, hormonal fatigue. Phos – delicate patients. Sep – hormonal disturbance.
Squint due to nervous disorder or trauma. Cic – from convulsions. Gels – due to motor weakness.

EyeSigns.modality: Worse after blood loss, menses, diarrhea
EyeSigns.notes: Pale eyes indicate anemia or exhaustion. Ferr & China are main anemic remedies. Nat-m with grief.
Twitching from nervous exhaustion or fright. Agar in overactive nerves, Zinc in children with tics.

EyeSigns.rubric: Eyes - Sensation of sand in eyes
EyeSigns.modality: Worse with dry weather, morning, reading
EyeSigns.notes: Dry, gritty sensation. Euphrasia and Arg-n classic; Sulph with dryness and photophobia.

Eyes - Sensation of sand in eyes
